alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern Union; Hudson (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued September 28 at 6:34AM EDT until September 28 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM TO 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 11 AM EDT FRIDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM FRIDAY TO MIDNIGHT EDT FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the first Coastal Flood Advisory, up to 1 ft of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. For the second Coastal Flood Advisory, up to 1 ft of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. For the third Coastal Flood Advisory, up to 1 ft of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Hudson, Eastern Essex and Eastern Union Counties. * WHEN...For the first Coastal Flood Advisory, from 6 PM to 10 PM EDT this evening. For the second Coastal Flood Advisory, from 7 AM to 11 AM EDT Friday. For the third Coastal Flood Advisory, from 7 PM Friday to midnight EDT Friday night. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is expected in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline during the times of high tide this evening into Friday evening. Expect up to 1 ft of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional rounds of minor coastal flooding are possible during the times of high tide this weekend. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. KILL VAN KULL AT BERGEN POINT NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 7.2 FT, MODERATE 8.5 FT, MAJOR 9.6 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.7 FT, MODERATE 3.0 FT, MAJOR 4.1 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 28/08 AM 6.8/ 7.3 1.3/ 1.8 0.7/ 1.1 1 NONE 28/08 PM 7.5/ 8.0 2.0/ 2.5 1.0/ 1.5 1 MINOR 29/09 AM 7.4/ 7.9 1.9/ 2.3 0.9/ 1.4 1 MINOR 29/09 PM 7.4/ 7.9 1.9/ 2.3 1.0/ 1.5 1 MINOR NEW YORK HARBOR AT THE BATTERY NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 7.0 FT, MODERATE 8.3 FT, MAJOR 9.4 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.9 FT, MODERATE 3.2 FT, MAJOR 4.3 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 28/08 AM 6.4/ 6.9 1.3/ 1.8 0.8/ 1.3 1 NONE 28/08 PM 6.7/ 7.2 1.6/ 2.0 0.8/ 1.3 1 NONE 29/09 AM 6.7/ 7.2 1.6/ 2.0 0.8/ 1.3 1 NONE 29/09 PM 6.7/ 7.2 1.6/ 2.0 0.9/ 1.4 1 NONE &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
